listitem.para: True if Int2 = Int1 + 1 and Int1 >= 0 At least one of the arguments must be instantiated to a natural number This predicate raises the domain-error not_less_than_zero if called with a negative integer E.g succ(X, 0) fails silently and succ(X, -1) raises a domain-error The behaviour to deal with natural numbers only was defined by Richard O'Keefe to support the common count-down-to-zero in a natural way
